instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 Beeps not passing post
threads.message:
Hi,
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Spill not real obvious damage. hit power button 3 beeps not passing post. Can this be <CHIP>U5870</CHIP>? (there was a little greasiness there)
Thanks,
Rick

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 Beeps not passing post
threads.message: Check if your ram is getting power if so, Preheat the board in the oven @275 for 5 min then put lots of flux and reflow the ram. If the Ram is not getting power, Investigate that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 Beeps not passing post
threads.message: Voltage on L7430? If 1V35 is ok then probably corrosion under RAM or CPU. Or someone fucked with it and knocked off component around RAM/CPU area.
